title: Drawing, "Niagara Falls in Winter", March 21, 1856
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray buff paper.
markings: Stamped in black ink, at lower left: Lugt 457d, noir
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at bottom left:  Niagara/ March 21.56; again at upper right:  2. Blue sha- dow  3. Illuminated with mist   /  4. Mist  5. Green  6. Grey green; again within bank, at left of center:  mist ; and within water, at right of center:  purplish.
description: Horizontal view of Niagara river rushing downstream and Falls cascading into pool in right foreground; a snow-covered bank, in left foreground, contains three straggly, bare trees with a more heavily forested bank on farshore. Horseshoe falls at right distance under bleak wintry sky filled with several thick clouds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Niagara Falls in Winter", March 21, 1856.
March 21, 1856. Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray buff paper.. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-144.
